page.title: 07Housing.Hoo area cont.
page.content: The Old Vicarage at Brandeston and the Old Rectory at Monewden are no longer occupied by the incumbent,but the Rect- or of Kettleburgh lives at the Rectory. Also at Kettleburgh the former Mill house is still in use but as an ordin- ary dwelling,the Mill having ceased to function many years ago. There are roughly 14 farm houses of working farms,with their farm buildings.These are all fairly large, substantial houses some dating back to the 16C. More recent housing is found in the Council house developments both in Brandeston & Kettleburgh.Originally intended to provide rented accommodation many council houses are now sold and their new owners seek ways of breaking the uniformity of design, e.g. by adding a porch,or conservatory.
